VEC.Q: How many chords are in this chord chart?
How many outer arcs are in this chord chart?

SRP.Q: In the chord chart, what is the next arc in the clockwise direction from arc Business?
SRP.A: The next arc clockwise from arc Business is arc {Arts}.

SRP.Q: In the chord chart, what is the next arc in the counterclockwise direction from arc Health Sciences?
SRP.A: The next arc counterclockwise from arc Health Sciences is arc {Engineering}.

VPR.Q: Which arc has the largest output flow in this chord chart?
Which arc has the largest input flow in this chord chart?

VE.Q: What is the flow value from Business to Arts in the chord chart?
What is the flow value from Engineering to Arts in the chord chart?

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum flow value between Engineering and Business in the chord chart?
EVJ.A: The maximum flow value between Engineering and Business is {107}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum flow value between Arts and Business in the chord chart?
EVJ.A: The minimum flow value between Arts and Business is {131}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum flow value in the chord chart?
What is the minimum flow value in the chord chart?

SC.Q: What is the total flow output from Business?
SC.A: The total flow output from Business is {286}.

SC.Q: What is the total flow input by Arts?
SC.A: The total flow input by Arts is {326}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow greater than 182? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {218} from {Arts} to {Engineering}, a flow of {195} from {Engineering} to {Arts}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow less than 69? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {59} from {Business} to {Health Sciences}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow between 101 and 149? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {140} from {Arts} to {Business}, a flow of {131} from {Business} to {Arts}, a flow of {107} from {Engineering} to {Business}.

NC.Q: Which flow is larger: from Business to Engineering or from Arts to Engineering?
NC.A: The flow from {Arts} to {Engineering} is larger.

NC.Q: Which flow is the largest: from Arts to Engineering, from Business to Engineering, or from Engineering to Arts?
NC.A: The flow from {Arts} to {Engineering} is the largest.

MSR.Q: Which category has the highest proportion of outgoing flow relative to its total flow?
MSR.A: The category with the highest proportion of outgoing flow relative to its total flow is {Health Sciences}.

MSR.Q: Which pair has the strongest chord connection in this chord chart?
MSR.A: The strongest chord connection is between {Arts} and {Engineering}.

VA.Q: To minimize the crossings between chords, please reorder the outer arcs and list the reorder arc order in clockwise direction.
VA.A: The reordered arc order in clockwise direction is: {Arc Arts, Arc Engineering, Arc Business, Arc Health Sciences}.
